class trailer.models.Account(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.contrib.auth.base_user.AbstractBaseUser, django.contrib.auth.models.PermissionsMixin

Custom user model

Parameters:
  • AbstractBaseUser – default
  • PermissionsMixin – default
Fieldname:

username
Fieldname:

is_teacher
Username:

name of the user
Is_teacher:

true if user is teacher and else false
Is_admin:

true if user is admin and else false
Is_active:

true if user is active and else false
Is_staff:

true if user is staff and else false
Is_superuser:

true if user is admin and else false
Date_joined:

date and time of joining of the user
Last_login:

date and time of last login of the user

date_joined¶

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

get_next_by_date_joined(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: date_joined>, is_next=True, **kwargs)¶
get_next_by_last_login(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: last_login>, is_next=True, **kwargs)¶
get_previous_by_date_joined(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: date_joined>, is_next=False, **kwargs)¶
get_previous_by_last_login(*, field=<django.db.models.fields.DateTimeField: last_login>, is_next=False, **kwargs)¶
groups¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the forward and reverse sides of a many-to-many relation.

In the example:

class Pizza(Model):
    toppings = ManyToManyField(Topping, related_name='pizzas')

Pizza.toppings and Topping.pizzas are ManyToManyDescriptor instances.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

host¶

Accessor to the related objects manager on the reverse side of a many-to-one relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Parent.children is a ReverseManyToOneDescriptor instance.

Most of the implementation is delegated to a dynamically defined manager class built by create_forward_many_to_many_manager() defined below.

A wrapper for a deferred-loading field. When the value is read from this object the first time, the query is executed.

class trailer.models.Assignment(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Assignment model defines name of the assignment,name of the problem statement,problem statement file,course model

Name:name of the assignment
File_name:problem statement file name
Assignfile:submitted problem statement file by the teacher
Course:course model
exception DoesNotExist¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned¶

Bases: django.core.exceptions.MultipleObjectsReturned

assignfile¶

The descriptor for the file attribute on the model instance. Return a FieldFile when accessed so you can write code like:

>>> from myapp.models import MyModel
>>> instance = MyModel.objects.get(pk=1)
>>> instance.file.size

Assign a file object on assignment so you can do:

>>> with open('/path/to/hello.world') as f:
...     instance.file = File(f)
course¶

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

class trailer.models.Course(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

course model defines host,participants,joincode,name of the course for a particular course

Name:name of the course
Host:host model
Partipants:students enrolled to a particular course model
Joincode:code required to register for a course

create_superuser(username, password, is_teacher)[source]¶

creates a superuser(admin)

Parameters:
  • self (self) – self
  • username (string) – name of the user
  • password (string) – password field
  • is_teacher (bool) – true if user is teacher
create_user(username, password, is_teacher, is_superuser)[source]¶

creates an account as specified(teacher or student)

Parameters:
  • self (self) – self
  • password (string) – password field
  • username (string) – name of the user
  • is_teacher (bool) – true if user is teacher
class trailer.models.Submission(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: django.db.models.base.Model

Submission model defines student model,submitted file by a particular student,name of the file recieved from the student,assignment model,feedback recieved to a student from techer,grade recieved to a student

Student:student model
Subfile:submitted file
File_name:name of the submitting file
Assignment:assignment model
Feedback:comments from teacher
Grade:grade from teacher

trailer.tests module¶

trailer.urls module¶

trailer.views module¶

trailer.views.assigndelete(request, pk)[source]¶

We get assignment name which is to be deleted and the course of that assignment Then it is deleted with the “delete()” and redirect to the coursepage

Parameters:pk (str) – Assignment name
trailer.views.coursedelete(request, pk)[source]¶

If the user is a teacher and it is logged in, if the request is to delete the a respective “pk” course in the delete.html,we use the delete function to remove it via a variable.Then it redirects to the teacherhome.

Parameters:pk (str) – Course name
trailer.views.courseform(request)[source]¶

This is used to create courses if the user is a teacher. If request.method is ‘POST’ and the data entered in the courseform.html page is stored in the “Courseform”.If the form is valid then the course is created

trailer.views.coursepage(request, pk)[source]¶

If the user is a teacher and it is logged in, get the course with course name as “pk” All the assignments which are in the respective course will get filtered and will be passed on in the context to the html page

Parameters:pk (str) – Course name
trailer.views.coursereg(request)[source]¶

If the user is a teacher and the request.method is ‘POST’,using the data entered in the coursereg.html which is stored in the coursecode, we register the student in a course that matches the coursecode and the redirect to the studenthome page

trailer.views.createassign(request, pk)[source]¶

In the course(found via pk) to create an assignment,we take the data which we retrieved from the createassign.html page and store them in respective variables.Then we create new instance assignment with the newly created variables and save the instance using “save()”

Parameters:pk (str) – Course name
trailer.views.createsub(request, nm)[source]¶

If the user is a student, It gets the assignment via name and the remaining variables then store the class with the parameters in the temp variable and redirect to the studentassign page

Parameters:pk (str) – Assignment name
trailer.views.editsub(request, oi)[source]¶

The submission which is obtained via id need to be edited The grades and feedback which are obtained from editsub.html will be edited in the submission if the request.method is ‘POST’

Parameters:oi (int) – Submission id
trailer.views.login_view(request)[source]¶

If the user is already authenticated, it will redirect to the respective home pages else if it is invalid then it stays the loginpage only.Using the username and password if it matches with the credentials which are already registered in the database or not if the user is present,Then it logs them in and redirect to the homepages.

trailer.views.logoutuser(request)[source]¶

I the user clicks on logout ,it redirects to the loginpage again

trailer.views.profileupdate(request, vary)[source]¶

After getting the account via id=vary, we use a Signup form to obtain the details to which the profile is to be updated If the request.method is ‘POST’, then the instance/account obtained using “vary” as the id is updated according to the responces filled in the form “Signup”.If any field is empty in the form,then the old entry of that field is restored.

Parameters:vary (int) – Account id
trailer.views.studentassign(request, pk)[source]¶

If the user is a student and it is logged in,we get the assignments with assignment name as “pk” as a query set using “filter”.Since we need an object we use .last() to obtain the assignment from the query set. All the submissions which are in the respective assignment and which are under the student’s(current user) name get filtered as a query_set.Using the “last()” function we get the submission object. Both of the objects will be passed on in the context to the html page.

Parameters:pk (str) – Assignment name
trailer.views.studentcourse(request, pk)[source]¶

If the user is a student and it is logged in, get the course with course name as “pk” All the assignments which are in the respective course will get filtered and will be passed on in the context to the html page

Parameters:pk (str) – Course name
trailer.views.studenthome(request)[source]¶

If the user is a student and it is logged in,the courses registered under the student’s name will be passed on as context along with the student’s id.

trailer.views.subteach(request, id)[source]¶

We get the respective submission by following the id and the user who is currently working and pass them as contexts in the subteach.html

Parameters:id (int) – Submission id
trailer.views.teachassign(request, pk)[source]¶

If the user is a teacher and it is logged in, get the assignments with assignment name as “pk” as a query set using “filter”.Since we need an object we use .last() to obtain the assignment from the query set All the submissions which are in the respective assignment will get filtered and will be passed on in the context to the html page along with the assignment

Parameters:pk (str) – Assignment name
trailer.views.teacherhome(request)[source]¶

If the user is teacher only then it can access the courses else it shows up the oops.html If the teacher is logged in,the courses registered by the teacher will be passed on as context along with the teacher’s id.

trailer.views.userregister(request)[source]¶

If the credentials are entered,and the given credentials are valid to register a new user will be saved in the database either as teacher or student depending on the role they choose while signingup.After saving, the page is redirected to the loginpage bacause the decorater used above the teacherhome and studenthome function requires you to be logged in because the .

trailer.views.wrong(request)[source]¶

If the student tries to access the teacher’s pages,Then this page will be displayed.
